title: Enki
summary: Enki (Sumerian: ð’€­ð’‚—ð’† ) is the Sumerian god of water, knowledge (gestÃº), mischief, crafts (gaÅ¡am), and creation (nudimmud), and one of the Anunnaki. He was later known as Ea or Ae[5] in Akkadian (Assyrian-Babylonian) religion, and is identified by some scholars with Ia in Canaanite religion. The name was rendered Aos in Greek sources (e.g. Damascius).[6]
